Class StateGame

java.lang.Object
  State
      StateGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener
public class StateGame
extends State

StateGame is a mode of the program where the user can play the game of Pacman various maps StateGame is a subclass of State

Author:
Ramsey Kant

Method Detail

getSessionScore

public int getSessionScore()
Get the current session score. A session score is the total score of the entire 'game' contained by the limited number of lives This is compounded at game over and in win()

See Also:
win(), lose()

reset

public void reset()
Reset the state of the game entirely (level 1)

Specified by:
reset in class State
See Also:
State.reset()

respawn

public void respawn(boolean nextLevel)
Respawns the player after a death or win. Similar to reset() except running vars are saved

Parameters:
nextLevel - Moves to the next level and corresponding map

logic

public void logic()
Main game logic for rendering and processing. Called by mainThreadLoop

Specified by:
logic in class State
See Also:
Game.mainThreadLoop(), State.logic()

end

public void end()
Player has died or the Supervisor has decided to change the state abruptly

Specified by:
end in class State
See Also:
State.end()

win

public void win()
Player has won, move to the next level Called by logic()

See Also:
logic()

lose

public void lose()
Player has died, reset() if lives remain. Otherwise, request a state change thereby end()ing this state Called by logic()

See Also:
logic()
